title: How to Build a Platform Bed

steps.title: Measure your mattress.
steps.content: Measure your mattress. Your platform should be 1 inch wider and 1 inch (2 to 3 cm) longer than your mattress, so when you put the mattress on the finished platform bed, there will be 1/2 inch (1 cm) of platform on each side.

steps.title: Subtract 12 inches (30 cm) from the length and width of your mattress to get the measurements for the base of your platform.
steps.content: Subtract 12 inches (30 cm) from the length and width of your mattress to get the measurements for the base of your platform. The base should be smaller than the platform to keep you from stubbing your toes on the base when you get into bed.

steps.title: Gather your materials.
steps.content: Gather your materials. In addition to the wood for your platform bed, you will need an assortment of tools and supplies, including painting or staining supplies.

steps.title: Build the base of the platform using either 2-by-8- or 2-by-10-foot boards.
steps.content: Build the base of the platform using either 2-by-8- or 2-by-10-foot boards. Consider things such as baseboard heaters, outlets and the thickness of your mattress when deciding how tall to build the platform.

steps.title: Cut the boards to the correct size for the base and arrange them on their edges in a rectangle.
steps.content: Cut the boards to the correct size for the base and arrange them on their edges in a rectangle. Measure and cut 2 or 3 crosspieces, depending on the size of the base, to fit inside the rectangle. Space the crosspieces at even intervals.

steps.title: Assemble the base using wood screws.
steps.content: Assemble the base using wood screws. Drill pilot holes for the screws in each board and apply carpenter's glue to the cut ends to help seal the joints. Use a carpenter's square to make sure all the boards meet at 90-degree angles.

steps.title: Place short pieces of board in the gaps between cross pieces and screw them in place to help stabilize the base.
steps.content: Place short pieces of board in the gaps between cross pieces and screw them in place to help stabilize the base. Stagger the pieces evenly.

steps.title: Allow time for the glue to dry.
steps.content: Allow time for the glue to dry. Cover the screw heads with wood putty, then paint or stain the outside of the base.

steps.title: Assemble the platform in the same manner as the base, remembering that the length and width of the platform will be 12 inches greater than the base.
steps.content: Assemble the platform in the same manner as the base, remembering that the length and width of the platform will be 12 inches greater than the base.

steps.title: Set the platform on top of the base, center it carefully, and screw it to the base wherever the long boards of the platform meet the long board of the base.
steps.content: Set the platform on top of the base, center it carefully, and screw it to the base wherever the long boards of the platform meet the long board of the base. Use long deck screws, remembering to drill pilot holes to keep the wood from splitting.

steps.title: Fit a sheet of medium density fiberboard to the top of the platform.
steps.content: Fit a sheet of medium density fiberboard to the top of the platform. Carefully apply carpenter's glue to the edges of the boards and screw the sheet to the platform, taking care to make sure the screws don't split the fiberboard.

steps.title: Attach edging to the fiberboard sheet to hide the unfinished edges.
steps.content: Attach edging to the fiberboard sheet to hide the unfinished edges.

steps.title: Allow time for the glue to dry, cover the screw heads with wood putty, then stain or paint the platform.
steps.content: Allow time for the glue to dry, cover the screw heads with wood putty, then stain or paint the platform.
